item.name: Checkouts
item.description:
Accept payments from your end users by adding the Checkouts model to your platform.
SumUp supports standard and single payment 3DS checkout flows.

The Checkout model allows creating, listing, retrieving, processing and deactivating checkouts.
A payment is completed by creating a checkout and then processing the checkout.

description.content: Get payment methods available for the given merchant to use with a checkout.
The amount for which the payment methods should be eligible, in major units. Note that currency must also be provided when filtering by amount.
The currency for which the payment methods should be eligible.
(Required) The SumUp merchant code.
The amount for which the payment methods should be eligible, in major units. Note that currency must also be provided when filtering by amount.
The currency for which the payment methods should be eligible.
The amount for which the payment methods should be eligible, in major units. Note that currency must also be provided when filtering by amount.
The currency for which the payment methods should be eligible.
The amount for which the payment methods should be eligible, in major units. Note that currency must also be provided when filtering by amount.
The currency for which the payment methods should be eligible.

Creates a new payment checkout resource. The unique `checkout_reference` created by this request, is used for further manipulation of the checkout.

For 3DS checkouts, add the `redirect_url` parameter to your request body schema.

Follow by processing a checkout to charge the provided payment instrument.
Lists created checkout resources according to the applied `checkout_reference`.
Filters the list of checkout resources by the unique ID of the checkout.
Filters the list of checkout resources by the unique ID of the checkout.
Filters the list of checkout resources by the unique ID of the checkout.
Retrieves an identified checkout resource. Use this request after processing a checkout to confirm its status and inform the end user respectively.
(Required) Unique ID of the checkout resource.

Processing a checkout will attempt to charge the provided payment instrument for the amount of the specified checkout resource initiated in the `Create a checkout` endpoint.

Follow this request with `Retrieve a checkout` to confirm its status.
(Required) Unique ID of the checkout resource.
Deactivates an identified checkout resource. If the checkout has already been processed it can not be deactivated.
(Required) Unique ID of the checkout resource.

item.name: Customers
item.description:
Allow your regular customers to save their information with the Customers model.
This will prevent re-entering payment instrument information for recurring payments on your platform.

Depending on the needs you can allow, creating, listing or deactivating payment instruments & creating, retrieving and updating customers.

description.content: Creates a new saved customer resource which you can later manipulate and save payment instruments to.
Retrieves an identified saved customer resource through the unique `customer_id` parameter, generated upon customer creation.
(Required) Unique ID of the saved customer resource.

Updates an identified saved customer resource's personal details.

The request only overwrites the parameters included in the request, all other parameters will remain with their initially assigned values.
(Required) Unique ID of the saved customer resource.
Lists all payment instrument resources that are saved for an identified customer.
(Required) Unique ID of the saved customer resource.
Deactivates an identified card payment instrument resource for a customer.
(Required) Unique ID of the saved customer resource.
(Required) Unique token identifying the card saved as a payment instrument resource.

item.name: Transactions
item.description:
Retrieve details for a specific transaction by its `id`
or any other required query parameter, or list all transactions related to the merchant account.

description.content: Refunds an identified transaction either in full or partially.
(Required) Unique ID of the transaction.

Retrieves the full details of an identified transaction. The transaction resource is identified by a query parameter and *one* of following parameters is required:

 *  `id`
 *  `internal_id`
 *  `transaction_code`
 *  `foreign_transaction_id`
 *  `client_transaction_id`
Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction ID (the `id` parameter in the transaction resource).
Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified internal transaction ID (the `internal_id` parameter in the transaction resource).
Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.

item.name: Payouts
item.description:
The Payouts model will allow you to track funds youve received from SumUp.
You can receive a detailed payouts list with information like dates, fees, references and statuses, using the `List payouts` endpoint.

item.name: API Keys
item.description:
API Keys allow your application to gain programmatic access to SumUp.
API Keys allow application to do authorized requests within the SumUp ecosystem. API Keys are scopes to single account and thus can't be used for endpoints where user presence is needed (for such endpoints it is necessary to use OAuth2).

description.content: List merchant's API keys.
Offset of the first API Key to return.
Maximum number of API Keys to return.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.

response.name: Returns a list of API Key objects.

description.content: Offset of the first API Key to return.
Maximum number of API Keys to return.
Create a new API key.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.

response.name: Returns the API Key object if the creation succeeded.

description.content: Retrieve an API key.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.
(Required) The ID of the API Key to retrieve.

response.name: Returns the API Key object for a valid identifier.

description.content: Update an API key.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.
(Required) The ID of the API Key to retrieve.

response.name: Returns an empty response if the update succeeded.

description.content: Delete an API key.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.
(Required) The ID of the API Key to retrieve.

response.name: Returns an empty response of the deletion succeeded.

description.content: Returns list of operators for currently authorized user's merchant.

item.name: Memberships
item.description: Endpoints to manage user's memberships. Memberships are used to connect the user to merchant accounts and to grant them access to the merchant's resources via roles.

item.name: Roles
item.description: Endpoints to manage custom roles. Custom roles allow you to tailor roles from individual permissions to match your needs. Once created, you can assign your custom roles to your merchant account members using the memberships.

description.content: List merchant's custom roles.
(Required) Merchant code.

response.name: Returns a list of Role objects.

description.content: Create a custom role for the merchant. Roles are defined by the set of permissions that they grant to the members that they are assigned to.
(Required) Merchant code.

response.name: Returns the Role object after successful custom role creation.

description.content: Retrieve a custom role by ID.
(Required) Merchant code.
(Required) The ID of the role to retrieve.

response.name: Returns the Role object for a valid identifier.

description.content: Delete a custom role.
(Required) Merchant code.
(Required) The ID of the role to retrieve.

response.name: Returns the deleted Role object if the deletion succeeded.

description.content: Update a custom role.
(Required) Merchant code.
(Required) The ID of the role to retrieve.

response.name: Returns the updated Role object if the update succeeded.

item.name: Readers
item.description: A reader represents a device that accepts payments. You can use the SumUp Solo to accept in-person payments.

description.content:
Create a Checkout for a Reader.

This process is asynchronous and the actual transaction may take some time to be stared on the device.


There are some caveats when using this endpoint:
* The target device must be online, otherwise checkout won't be accepted
* After the checkout is accepted, the system has 60 seconds to start the payment on the target device. During this time, any other checkout for the same device will be rejected.

**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.24.3 or higher.
(Required)
(Required) The unique identifier of the reader.

response.name: The Checkout got successfully created for the given reader.

description.content:
Create a Terminate action for a Reader.

It stops the current transaction on the target device.

This process is asynchronous and the actual termination may take some time to be performed on the device.


There are some caveats when using this endpoint:
* The target device must be online, otherwise terminate won't be accepted
* The action will succeed only if the device is waiting for cardholder action: e.g: waiting for card, waiting for PIN, etc.
* There is no confirmation of the termination.

If a transaction is successfully terminated and `return_url` was provided on Checkout, the transaction status will be sent as `failed` to the provided URL.

**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.28.0 or higher.
(Required)
(Required) The unique identifier of the reader.

response.name: The Terminate action was successfully dispatched for the given reader.

description.content: List all readers of the merchant.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.

response.name: Returns a list Reader objects.

description.content: Retrieve a Reader.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.
(Required) The unique identifier of the reader.

Return the reader only if it has been modified after the specified timestamp given in the headers.

Timestamps are accepted in the following formats:

 - HTTP Standard: [IMF format (RFC 5322)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5322#section-3.3), sometimes also referred to as [RFC 7231](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
 - RFC 3339: Used for timestamps in JSON payloads on this API.

response.name: Returns a Reader object for a valid identifier.

 - RFC 3339: Used for timestamps in JSON payloads on this API.

description.content:
Return the reader only if it has been modified after the specified timestamp given in the headers.

Timestamps are accepted in the following formats:

 - HTTP Standard: [IMF format (RFC 5322)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5322#section-3.3), sometimes also referred to as [RFC 7231](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
 - RFC 3339: Used for timestamps in JSON payloads on this API.

response.name: The requested Reader resource does not exists.

description.content:
Return the reader only if it has been modified after the specified timestamp given in the headers.

Timestamps are accepted in the following formats:

 - HTTP Standard: [IMF format (RFC 5322)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5322#section-3.3), sometimes also referred to as [RFC 7231](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
 - RFC 3339: Used for timestamps in JSON payloads on this API.
Delete a reader.
(Required) Unique identifier of the merchant account.
(Required) The unique identifier of the reader.

response.name: Returns an empty response if the deletion succeeded.

description.content:
SumUps REST API operates with [JSON](https://www.json.org/json-en.html) HTTP requests and responses. The request bodies are sent through resource-oriented URLs and use the standard [HTTP response codes](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Status).

You can experiment and work on your integration in a sandbox that doesn't affect your regular data and doesn't process real transactions. To create a sandbox merchant account visit the [dashboard](https://me.sumup.com/settings/developer). To use the sandbox when interacting with SumUp APIs [create an API](https://me.sumup.com/settings/api-keys) key and use it for [authentication](https://developer.sumup.com/api/authentication).
